title: Cat. 73.2  Manao tupapau (She Thinks of the Ghost or The Ghost Thinks of Her), from L’estampe originale, 1894
publication_title: Gauguin Paintings, Sculpture, and Graphic Works at the Art Institute of Chicago
content:
<section class="osci-tk-epub-section tombstone" id="tombstone">Manao tupapau (She Thinks of the Ghost or The Ghost Thinks of Her), from L’estampe originale  
1894  
Lithograph with pen and tusche, brush and tusche wash, lithographic crayon, and incising in black ink on ivory wove paper (discolored to cream); 180 × 271 mm (image); 423 × 594 mm (sheet)  
The Art Institute of Chicago, gift of Jeffrey Shedd, 1975.1042  
Guérin 50, Kornfeld 23 C  
For the verso, see fig. 73.2.1

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section provenance" id="provenance">Given by Jeffrey Shedd (1903–1994), Chicago, to the Art Institute of Chicago, 1975.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section exhibitions" id="exhibitions">Art Institute of Chicago, Graphic Tours: Travel and Nineteenth-Century French Works on Paper, Jan. 14–Apr. 7, 1994, no cat.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section references" id="references">Elizabeth Mongan, Eberhard W. Kornfeld, and Harold Joachim, Paul Gauguin: Catalogue Raisonné of His Prints, with assistance of Christine E. Stauffer (Galerie Kornfeld, 1988), pp. 118, 120, cat. 23.

Museo di Santa Giulia, Gauguin, Van Gogh: L’avventura del colore nuovo, exh. cat. (Museo di Santa Giulia, 2005), pp. 255–56 (ill.).

Henri Dorra, The Symbolism of Paul Gauguin: Erotica, Exotica, and the Great Dilemmas of Humanity (University of California Press, 2007), pp. 218–19, 238, fig. 112.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section other_documentation" id="other_documentation">Signed on stone, upper left, with brush and black tusche in black: P G O

Inscribed on stone, lower left, with pen and black tusche over brush and black tusche wash in black: Manao tupapau

Inscribed lower right, in graphite: KG10154

Inscribed lower right, in graphite: 9749

</section><section epub:type="footnotes" id="footnotes">Exhibition checklist on file in Prints and Drawings, Art Institute of Chicago.

</section><section id="figures">Cat. 73.2 Manao tupapau (She Thinks of the Ghost or The Ghost Thinks of Her), from L'estampe originale, 1894.

fig. 73.2.1 Verso of Gauguin’s Manao tupapau (She Thinks of the Ghost or The Ghost Thinks of Her) (1894). The Art Institute of Chicago, 1975.1042.

</section>
